results.title: The Minders
results.brief_description: A science fiction drama about life after death and a group of spirits, called the Minders, who watch over and provide guidance for special human beings.

results.title: The Mind of Nicolas Poussin: the Seven Sacraments
results.creator_credit: Samaritan Films and Dudley Shaw Ashton
results.brief_description: Discusses the painting of the Seven Sacraments, by French born artist, Nicolas Poussin, between 1644 and 1648 which is now housed at the National Gallery of Scotland, Edinburgh.

results.title: The Mind of man
results.brief_description: A survey of modern research on the mind in various countries of the world. Covers areas of mind development in children, effects of drugs, dreams, brain structure, the brain and sexuality, reasoning, and the power of the mind in controlling bodily functions. Includes interviews with Sir John Eccles, Donald Hebb and B.F. Skinner. Introduced by Magnus Magnusson, commentary by Marius Goring.

results.title: The Mind machines
results.brief_description: Discusses research being done on artificial intelligence, a branch of computer science. Explores possible developments such as computer controlled robots equipped with a sense of vision and the ability to respond flexibly to changing conditions.

results.title: The Mind hidden and divided
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
How do events and experiences in the subconscious affect our moods, actions and health? In this program, Philip Zimbardo explores the power of the subconscious to control pain and to alter consciousness following suggestions made under hypnosis. He also examines cases where the subconscious spills over into consciousness and produces personality disorders such as multiple personalities.

results.title: The Mind awake and asleep
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
In this program, Philip Zimbardo examines consciousness, daydreaming and sleep. He follows the history of the study of consciousness, asking what it is that allows us to receive relevant information from our environment and ignore irrelevant information. Other psychologists explain the importance of daydreaming and sleep, especially REM (Rapid Eye Movement) sleep where dreaming occurs. Freud’s theories on dream analysis where dreams are seen to hold significant meaning are contrasted with more recent dream theory which denies the meaning of dreams.

results.title: The Mime of Marcel Marceau
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Daniel Camus
results.brief_description: Scenes from various classes conducted by Marcel Marceau and the teachers of his school are intercut with actual performances including “The Maskmaker”, “The Painter” and “The Creation”. Looks at the work of Marcel Marceau, both private and public. it is in the private domain that we see the “other” side of him - that is to say, his everyday reality of teaching mime.

results.title: The Millionairess
results.creator_credit: Pierre Rouve, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Anthony Asquith
results.brief_description: Sophia Loren plays spoilt millionairess, Epifania Parerga, who having inherited her father’s fortune, is unhappily married and suicidal. When she meets the mild mannered Indian doctor, Ahmed el Kabir, (Peter Sellers in typical disguise), she pursues him with fervour. But despite Epifania’s schemes to attract Ahmed, he is impervious to her allure. Ahmed, who is devoted to running his clinic for the poor, challenges Epifania to live for three months without wealth in order to prove their suitability. He in turn accepts her challenge to turn 500 pounds into 15,000 in three months. Based on the play by Bernard Shaw, the screenplay was significantly updated to accommodate Loren’s physical charms and Sellers’ particular brand of comedy. The results are a mixed bag, with the chemistry between the two leads barely flaring, despite their mutual talents. Running gags revolve around every man falling for Loren, except the one she wants and Loren’s elaborate seduction of the doctor.

results.title: The Milling machine
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and DCA Educational Products
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Machines”.
Didactic film illustrating the various parts of the vertical and horizontal milling machines. Shows nomenclature of vertical and horizontal milling machines; similarities and differences of vertical and horizontal milling machines; and use of the power feed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
